column1: bhutan_diplo_reform_desc;Centuries of stability have turned the Imperial Parliament into little more than a useless talking-shop
column2: whose members have more holidays than work days in the year. It desperately needs reforming
column3: but only a highly persuasive Emperor could do so
column4: and it would require a lot of capital
column5: both political and monetary.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: bhutan_martial_reform;Whip The Dragon Army Into Shape;;;;;;;;;x
bhutan_martial_reform_desc;The Dragon Army hasn't had to fight a serious war in centuries
column2: confining itself to minor skirmishes
column3: border patrol
column4: and occasional tributary wars against vastly inferior forces. It has become complacent
column5: nepotism is rampant
column6: and the position of officer is seen as a cushy job rather than a serious calling to sacrifice for one's country. It would take a skilled and forceful Emperor with a strong knowledge of military strategy to clean this mess up.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: bhutan_stewardship_reform_desc;Bhutan's tax laws are arcane and convoluted
column2: as special exemptions have been granted over the years and never revoked
column3: not to mention the fact that the system used for tax calculation is needlessly complicated. It would take an Emperor with a lot of political will and a fine administrative mind to sort this out.;;;;;;;;;x

column2: our spy network has grown inefficient
column3: with powerful nobles co-opting much of it for use against their political rivals. This makes it much harder for us to ensure our spies are actually going where we need them to go. Only an Emperor with considerable experience in the subtle arts will be able to rub out this problem.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: bhutan_learning_reform_desc;The justified belief that our glorious ancestors have already discovered everything worth knowing has caused our academia to become hidebound
column2: teaching only what has been widely accepted for centuries and crushing any new idea mercilessly. While a healthy reserve about new ideas is entirely correct
column3: this attitude has been allowed to grow to an unhealthy extent. A wise and learned Emperor will be needed to restore order.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: bhutan2Desc;No sooner have you ascended to the Throne than you step out upon the Lotus Pavilion
column2: a great raised platform overlooking the streets of the capital. Below you
column3: thousands of cheering subjects wait on your words
column4: dragon banners flying overhead. You will have only one chance to make a first impression on the crowd
column5: and the stance you take here will color the future of your entire reign. What will you speak of?;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA_bhutan2;Bhutan is perfect! We neither want nor need contact with the barbarians outside.;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTB_bhutan2;We will trade with the barbarians and pacify the warlike
column2: but we have no interest in their land.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTC_bhutan2;We will bring the light of civilisation to the barbarians! To war!;;;;;;;;;x

column2: the small mountain nation of Bhutan has reigned stable and steadfast
column3: seemingly immune to the storms and tribulations of the world. Legends state that even the Event barely touched them
column4: and that much of the wisdom of the Old World is preserved in the great Catacombs beneath Bumthang. To the people of Tibet and India
column5: the Thunder Dragon Empire is simply like the ground beneath a man's feet - he rarely notices it
column6: but he could not imagine it ceasing to exist. \nHowever
column7: long centuries of peace had made the Bhutanese complacent. Their tax system grew inefficient
column8: their scholars ceased to learn anything new
column9: and their army grew rife with nepotism and laziness. That has all changed
column10: however. Over the past few decades
column11: the Emperors have gradually managed to reform their country's ageing systems
column12: and now they have completed their work. With their country once again revitalised
column13: the Thunder Dragon may yet again spread its wings across Eastern Asia...;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTB_bhutan3;I've got a bad feeling about this...;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTC_bhutan3;Who are these people and why are you telling me about them?;;;;;;;;;x
bhutan4Desc;Without the distractions of war or the need to produce weapons for the maintenance of order
column2: Bhutan's great industries have flourished
column3: providing us with a great surplus of wealth. You could choose to reap the benefits of this immediately
column4: or you could re-invest it into your own demesne.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA_bhutan4;The treasury will benefit from this!;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTB_bhutan4;Our land will become ever more prosperous!;;;;;;;;;x
bhutan5Desc;Bhutan's bureacratic system is highly efficient at administrating land - specifically
column2: the land within Bhutan itself
column3: which they've gotten so used to dealing with that it's often joked that the bureacrats could do their jobs while asleep. Unfortunately
column4: we've found ourselves in possession of land outside of those familiar schema
column5: and they're having a bit of trouble with it. In fact
column6: they are proving frankly incompetent at managing it
column7: and have bungled it horribly. Now the peasants are angry
column8: the taxes aren't being collected
column9: and many within the Empire are starting to wonder if taking this land was worth it in the first place.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA_bhutan5;What a pain in the neck!;;;;;;;;;x
bhutan_crumbled_diplomacy_desc;This nation is so used to its traditions and to being bowed down to that their diplomats have largely forgotten the subtle arts they're supposed to know.;;;;;;;;;x
bhutan_crumbled_martial_desc;This nation's armies haven't fought a serious war in so long that they've become corrupt
column2: filled with nepotistically-appointed fools.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: bhutan_crumbled_stewardship_desc;This country has enjoyed peace and prosperity for so long that its tax code has become labyrinthine and woefully outdated.;;;;;;;;;x
bhutan_crumbled_intrigue_desc;This nation's spy system is almost wholly outside the control of its ruler
column2: with local nobles having most of the agents in their pockets.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: bhutan_crumbled_learning_desc;This nation's intellectuals by and large believe they have nothing more to learn
column2: hindering any attempt at progress.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: ring_of_elves_desc;This strange ring is said by Novelists to be a mystical artifact that was once held by an ancient elven king. They are not the only ones to believe in its strange and seemingly magical abilities
column2: as it is said to have the power to deflect all objects that would mean it's wielder harm
column3: and that it glows with a low yellow light. Its powers are said to only activate for a person of a certain mental aquity. Abrahamics believe it to be a remnant from the Garden of Eden and that God created it to protect Adam and Eve from all possible harm.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: ca_flaktower_desc;This strange tower has sat in the region for time immemorial. It is made of a strange substance that renders it indestructible to modern technology and seems to have been built as a defensive structure in the antideluvian era. It is unclear to modern chroniclers what the war was that would have required such a structure.;;;;;;;;;x
tp_andorra_relicuary_desc;Here the ancient King-Bishops of Andorra hoarded many antideluvian artifacts
column2: both of a religious and secular nature. The monks regularly brought antedeluvian artifacts from the reliquary for study and attempts at reproduction. These monks hold the title of Replicantii and only they
column3: the King-Bishop and the Pope may handle the artifacts.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: laureate_blood;This option is available because the blood of a legendary §YLaureate§! flows through your veins;;;;;;;;;x
bhutan_will_lose_land;You will gain all lands in the de jure of Bhutan
column2: §Ybut will lose all external land.§! Vassals will become independent
column3: and demesne land outside of Bhutan will be granted to new rulers.;;;;;;;;;x

column2: a small group of the republic's citizens elect their leader from amongst themselves
column3: with the leader ruling until their death. This system differs from the feudal system since it is not inherently hereditary. However
column4: it often can become such due to corruption. It differs from a Merchant Republic since its main focus is not trade
column5: however
column6: it can partake in it..;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: muwa_christian_desc;The School of the Diligent is a religious-philosophical branch of the Muwahidunna faith
column2: focussing on hard work and the glorification of God through charity and almsgiving to one's neighbour. It focuses on the building up of God's people through love
column3: and is most popular among Christians and those of a Christian heritage.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: muwa_sunni_desc;The School of the Saber is a religious-philosophical branch of the Muwahidunna faith
column2: focussing on the use of force in service to God against idolaters and unbelievers of all stripes. This school traditionally draws inspiration and followers from Sunni Islam
column3: and was the one followed by Isma'il himself.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: muwa_shiite_desc;The School of Resistance is a religious-philosophical branch of the Muhawidunna faith
column2: focussing on resistance against evil
column3: both internally (through asceticism) and externally (through defensive warfare). This school traditionally draws support from Shia Islam.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: muwa_kneeler_desc;The School of the Kneelers is a religious-philosophical branch of the Muwahidunna faith
column2: focussing on submission to God almost to the exclusion of all else. They read Scripture
column3: pray twelve times a day
column4: and tend to form monastic communities for mutual spiritual betterment. This School is the only one with roughly equal popularity among Christians
column5: Jews
column6: and Muslims.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: muwa1Desc;The Muwahidunna faith allows its adherents a wide (though not infinitely wide) berth in terms of religious belief and praxis. Thus
column2: several schools have grown up
column3: focussing around different aspects of traditional piety. You have chosen to associate yourself with a partricular school
column4: but which one?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA_muwa1;The Diligent Ones' good works appeal to me;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTB_muwa1;The Way of the Saber will slay my enemies;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTC_muwa1;The Way of Resistance will defend me from the unbelievers;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTD_muwa1;I wish to see other Paths;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTA_muwa2;The piety of the Kneelers impress me;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTB_mura2;I wish to see other Paths;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
choose_muwa_school_desc;The Muwahidunna faith has many strains of thought. I should associate myself with one of them.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
muwahidunna_FEATURES;§Y*§! Adherents can associate with one of several schools
column2: granting different bonuses;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
Alexander conquered a great empire
column3: bringing the Hellenic faith from Macedonia to Bactria. As a follower of the Hellenic faith
column4: you can attempt to restore this mighty Empire for the glory of Alexander Anaxorgos.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: crown_bhutan;The Raven Crown of the Thunder Dragon;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
crown_bhutan_desc;This crown has for centuries been worn by the emperors of the Thunder Dragon Empire even going so far as to be rumoured to be antedeluvian in nature.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

crown_transnistria_desc;This crown is part of the traditional regal attire of Transnistrian emperors. It is rumoured to be so ancient to have been worn by the legendary kings of Moldovia in the antedeluvian age.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
crown_britannia_desc;This crown has been for centuries at the heart of british politics
column2: both for its religious significance
column3: having been granted to the Lord protector by the Queen herself and for it's status as a symbol of one's dominion over the British Isles.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
